title: Facebook and X.com
content: I can not sign into Facebook or X.com. Can you help me?
creator: debhalverso

title: Don't remember password to mail.com account
content: I was having issues with the app for my mail.com account so my thought was to delete it and then reinstall it Just prior to doing that I wasn't sure if I remembered my password or not because I never log out of the app anyway I went to forget password and put in the info and it said it sent an email to an old phone number that I used to have and I don't have access to anymore. I've sent three emails to support at mail.com to no avail so I went to Google passwords to see if there was anything in there, there wasn't. So I was playing around looking to see if I could figure it out and turned off the synchronization and it logged me out up until then I had access emailed support again again still haven't got a response then I remembered Firefox Mozilla had some sort of password thing I just had to find it maybe it would be in there so I ran across this website of mozilla's logged in and it had my Yahoo account as a primary and my mail.com as a secondary I'm not sure how all this works and I'm not sure if I did the right thing or not but I was able to reverse them make mail.com The primary and my Yahoo the secondary I'm not sure how to use this thing as I'm not all that savvy on this kind of thing anybody any help would be appreciated, thank you, Scott Stone
creator: scottstone82414

title: "Your request cannot be processed" at facebook login
content:
I can no longer log in to Facebook without this type of message popping up: "Your request could not be processed." These messages do not look like they come from Facebook. When I "X" out of the messages, the page looks fine, but I'm not taking chances to log in with this sketchy situation. I have deleted cookies, etc. multiple times, even though I have Firefox set to delete cookies upon closing.

No problems on my other browser...except that I don't want to use that browser. I want to use Firefox with Facebook like I have for almost a decade.
creator: shermar73

title: Compatibility Issue with Firefox on OS X 10.10 for Microsoft Copilot
content:
I am currently using OS X 10.10 (Yosemite) and I have been experiencing compatibility issues while trying to use Microsoft Copilot with Firefox. (I get a blank screen.)

As for ChatGPT - I can type a message into ChatGPT, but am unable to submit the message.

Could you please provide guidance or recommend a version of Firefox that would work best with OS X 10.10 and support Microsoft Copilot (and hopefully ChatGPT as well?)

I'm currently running Firefox 78.15.0esr (64-bit)
creator: btswire

title: Account Disconnected
content:
Hello. I got a new laptop (Windows 11) and have been trying to sign in to my main account for an hour. I can "sign in" with my email and password, and I get the account recovery code in my email. I then enter that, then I am immediately told that my account is "disconnected", even though by all other indications, I am signed in. I mean, I have to be signed in to create this post!

I read over other posts, and some of their issues seem to stem from something about their default profile. However, 1) I should still be able to sign in to a non-default profile, 2) I have been able to sign in to a different (student) profile just fine. I have uninstalled and reinstalled FF twice now, with full deletion of profiles etc. And no luck.

Other posts have mentioned antivirus software interference, but that doesn't explain why my other (student) profile works fine.

Also, when I try to create a recovery key, I am presented with an "unknown error" screen. I have attached a screenshot of that.
creator: luke.haskell

title: Firefox very slow to load some websites lately
content:
At some point in the last few weeks -- possibly after an upgrade -- I've noticed that some websites such as the Washington Post and Fidelity can take minutes rather than seconds to load. The problem doesn't seem to be with the sites themselves (because they load fine on Chrome) or with my hardware (because exactly the same thing happens on both of my computers). Has anyone else noticed this?

( I'm running Firefox 131.0.3 on Windows.)
creator: BlebNevus1015

title: supposed bug in firefox browser while using LinkedIn
content:
I have a bug that appears in LinkedIn. LI is adamant that this is a browser problem even though it also appears in "edge" browser. I have found this problem in Firefox even though my version is up to date. In one frame when I link to it the frame is squashed an parts of the frame appear on the left of the window. Image bad bad is the first attachment. image bad bad good is my status from Firefox. Even though they claim the problem is in the browser they provide no proof.

Here is history of LI messages:

Reference # 241002-031396 Status: Waiting For Information

View your case(s) on our Help Center You may reply to this case for up to 14 days Response (10/22/2024 13:41 CST)

Hi Larry,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Yla, and I am writing to provide you with an update regarding the issue you reported.

I have communicated with our technical team regarding the attached file you sent earlier. According to their assessment, the problem appears to be related to the browser you are currently using. To address this, I recommend trying the following steps: 

   Restart Firefox: This may resolve any temporary glitches you are experiencing.    Use an Alternative Browser: If the issue persists, consider using one of the following supported browsers: Firefox, Safari, Chrome, or Microsoft Edge.

In addition, since this matter is specifically related to your browser, you may wish to contact the support team of the browser you are currently utilizing for further assistance. They may have additional insights or solutions that can help resolve your issue more effectively.

I appreciate your patience and understanding as we work to resolve this matter. Should you have any further questions or require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out.

Thank you for your patience and cooperation with us.

Regards,

Yla Member Support Consultant

title: problem with my hotmail
content:
My email was hacked in a data breach decades ago but I am now getting more serious problems: I and my friends on my contact list are getting spam emails from me. So they are actually using my email account to send them and therefore I cannot block them.

Also, I have noticed that I am not getting emails from my bank and energy company who say that they have been delivered. However I have not received them.

Is there a way to stop this? Someone suggested setting up an alias email account linked to my email. Would this work? I have tried a full scan but cannot find anything suspicious on my laptop or phone.

Does anyone know how I can sort this problem out?
creator: mike.richards5316

title: Firefox version not working
content: Firefox browser updated to a version that will not work on my Windows 10 computer
creator: moody9007

title: Cannot remove site from synced Multi-Account Container
content:
I have a problem similar to the one detailed in this archived thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1406314

At one point, I accidentally added duckduckgo (default search) to a container and now I simply cannot remove it from the container assignment. What happens is I remove it on my local computer, but if I go to any other computer that syncs Mozilla containers to my account, it seems like it reassigns DDG to the container again..... even if I remove it yet again.

This seems like an endless loop.

Is there any way to definitively remove a site from a container and force it to sync across all browsers/computers? Something seems awry with which change with a container update is kept as the "default" that gets synced across all the sessions.

Thank you.
creator: scootle

title: Languages for downloading
content:
Hello Among the language choices for downloading, Macedonian is not included. Are there any plans to offer Macedonian?

Thank you for your support
creator: alpenglow1

title: Hyperlinks giving bizarre yellow box in upper right.
content:
I have a Dropbox Paper document that I use for my bookmarks. It lists the name of the site (with link attached) and hints as to my username/password for any given site I use.

For years, it has worked just fine, but trying to solve a different problem, something happened (in my settings?) that renders those hyperlinks non-working. When I click on, say Facebook, it formerly took me right to FB. NOW it gives me a weird yellow box in the upper right corner that says "about:blank" in the upper left of the box, and 3 white boxes at the lower right of the yellow box "Allow" "Deny" "Close." If I click on "Allow," I get a blank page. My navigation doesn't seem to recognize the links I've placed in the Doc.

A friend on FB posted a link to a YouTube video and when I clicked on that, I got the yellow box with the proper URL and a white box option to continue. I've tried to recreate that particular box, but, apparently, once it's accepted, it's OK from there on out.

I have tried deleting the link from the Paper Doc and reinstating it, and I still get the yellow box.

What have I done and how the heck do I get rid of that yellow box?
creator: xyz10

title: WSJ.com unusable on Firefox
content:
Hello,

WSJ.com is unusable on this browser. I've cleared cookies/site data, as well as disabled adblocker. Every other website works fine. Every other browser loads WSJ.com with no problem. But on Firefox with WSJ, the website loads very slowly, only ever partially, and sometimes not at all. This has been a perennial issue. Thank you.

title: Cursor not longer working.
content:
We have two Macbook Air computers, both using Firefox. On one of them the cursor no longer works on a particular website. Both laptops have Firefox 301.03.

The website tech help said Firefox was not compatible with their site but the problem is only one of the computers. What could be causing the problem?

content: My Apple MacBook Air is 10 years old but it does all I need. I'm 80 years old and marginally functional with computers I'm getting a bar that says I need to update my browser. I want to continue using Firefox like I have been for years. I've been trying to update in every way I can see to try but no success. Can anyone help me?
creator: adie44g

title: Passwords.json & key4.db
content:
For around 4-5 years I had problems with the password manager - I've not been able to see my passwords, neither to add a new password to the password manager. The autofill has been working fine.

I finally got the energy today to finally solve this. I've been reading different articles and did following:

1. Created new profile 2. Put the passwords.json and key4.db into the new profile

After the change non of the profiles is even showing the passwords in autofill. How can I validate if the passwords.json + key4.db is the correct ones?

Now I'm panicing since I don't even have the autofill possibility...
creator: ap21

title: Cookies & other private data being cleared
content: I launched a financial website from laptop #1 using Firefox to model some ideas in their calculators. 24 hrs later, I launched the same site from laptop #2 using Firefox as well, and was perplexed as to why the website had all the same information I had input the day before already populating the fields accessed 24 hrs prior. Are my settings out of spec to expect all info be blocked?

title: Can't get Firefox on Chromebook
content:
I have a Lenovo Chromebook, (Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 Chromebook | 14 Inch FHD Laptop | MediaTek Kompanio 520 | 4GB RAM | 64GB eMMC | Chrome OS | Abyss Blue) version is 129, and Firefox will not download, I have tried doing this from the Play store and even though I click to "download to this device" it keeps downloading the smartphone app which is no use to me, I really need the full app please. I have also downloaded the Linux beta Firefox and again it's the smartphone one. I have spent hours and hours and hours on this, please help.

Kind regards Polly.

title: Not working
content: Recently, the Firefox browser stopped working. Specifically for me, Costco's website, and Aetna. I believe the issue could be that those websites require that the location is confirmed, but no pop is generated, thus causing the website to not work with Firefox. Please help me, as your browser is the best.
creator: rcarlton1999

title: Sponsored Shortcuts
content:
Hello,

My name is Vasilis, i'm a data analyst. This is not a question per se; feel free to ignore it. God knows i hate writing emails. It's about your new "sponsored shortcuts" feature and my reasons for disabling it.

Basically... i dont click on new things, ever. If i need something new, i'll look it up, but i wont get to click something new just for being there, nor will i get accustomed to a brand like that. I know it's ad revenue for you guys, but I like my search as simple and distraction-free as it gets. Hell, some times I even just type links on the search bar to begin with.

So yeah. I dont know how marketing works, and how this pays off. I work in marketing; i despise marketing. Your sponsors can suck it. I'll make a donation so you guys can keep doing the good work.

My best regards, Vasilis
creator: vasilispateloudis

title: Sign-In & Sync
content:
Hi,

I'm posting because I noticed that there is a repeat issue with my Firefox login. When I try to log in on a new browser, my password is always rejected and my account even receives the "lock" for using an incorrect password. The first time this happened, I tried every password option I have and then ultimately changed my password and last some browsing data thinking I was wrong. This time I decided to set up a recovery key after my password was rejected on another browser and was able to successfully use the same password rejected by my new browser to set up that recovery key on my existing browser. This means that my password and email are correct, but for some reason they aren't recognized outside of one browser. If I can't sync my browsers I will have to completely use Edge which isn't ideal.

Is this something I can fix in my settings? Or is this a glitch/bug with my account that I can report somewhere? I'd like to access my data.
creator: darcey.fin

title: Printing: repeat Grid and Flex headers on every page
content:
Hi, This might be more a feature request than a question, although I hope it's already been implemented as a Firefox-only feature.

My question: is it possible to print several pages with a CSS grid or flex element with an automatically repeated header?

I used to use TABLE, THEAD and TH elements in HTML and they repeat nicely on every page. Now, I converted the table into a grid, which has several nice options that render our data much better on the screen, but when it comes to printing it lacks the possibility to set the first line as a header so that it will be printed on every page. What's more, grid cells can be printed half on one page and the other half on the next.

Are there some special CSS settings for a grid in Firefox, so that this works correctly?

TIA!

Sjef

Recently I've upgraded from Kubuntu 24.04 to 24.10. I'm almost sure that the minimize/restore buttons were available in my Firefox after the system upgrade. For the last few days I can see they are missing - please see attached images.

But I would like to have the default behavior: title bar is turned off and the mentioned 3 buttons be visible in the tab bar.

How to have those buttons in the tab bar when the title bar is turned off?

title: Urgent: Need Help Recovering Lost Passwords After Firefox Sync Issue
content:
Dear Firefox Support Team,

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to seek urgent assistance in recovering my saved passwords, which appear to have been lost following a recent reinstallation of Windows 11. Issue Details: 

   I reinstalled Windows 11 and attempted to sync my main Firefox account, but none of my saved passwords have appeared in the browser, despite trying multiple solutions.    I have already tried the following steps:        Ensured I was logged into the same Firefox account and enabled sync for Logins and Passwords.        Attempted manual sync multiple times.        Checked my Firefox Lockwise settings and verified that no passwords were visible there.        Tried logging out and back into my account and using the "Sync Now" feature again.

Further Attempts: 

   I checked for possible Firefox profile backups from my previous Windows installation but could not find any recoverable data related to saved passwords.    Unfortunately, I do not have a recovery key, and it seems I did not export my passwords prior to reinstalling Windows.    I also explored other possible recovery options, such as using system restore points, checking other browsers, and scanning for old profile files, but none have yielded results.

I would greatly appreciate any assistance or guidance in recovering my lost passwords. If there is any way to retrieve the data from the Firefox Sync server or another potential method I might have missed, I would be grateful for your support.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Kind regards, Syed Zain Abbas
creator: imzainabbas

title: Sign in succeeds then instantly disconnects
content:
I'm trying to login to my Mozilla account on a new laptop. I go through the usual process, and it appears to succeed, but when I get to about:preferences?action=pair#sync, the UI says "Please sign in to reconnect".

I noticed that Mozilla was sending TWO identical authorization code email messages, so I thought that there might be a problem with the new and old laptops having the same hostname (they do). So I logged out completely from the new device, changed the hostname, rebooted, and tried again.

It didn't help, and I continue to receive TWO identical email messages when I try to login (and the login continues to fail).

I've read that this could be profile related, but this is an absolutely new OS install: the only profile is "default".

Anybody seen (or fixed) this?
creator: manager57

title: Firefox Extension "Tab Session Manager" will not open saved session tabs as a GROUP
content:
Firefox Extension "Tab Session Manager" will not open saved session tabs as a GROUP

From session to session, Tab Session Manager (TSM) displays any tab I have left open when I shut down Firefox. The TSM display of tabs appears in a vertical column (left side of screen) provided by the Firefox extension, Tree Style Tabs. At any time, I have a total of perhaps 600 tabs distributed among four separate windows in TSM, with each window linked to the task bar at screen bottom, letting me choose which window to display, full-screen,

Running Windows 7 64bit SP1, I have had no problems until now displaying any of the four windows, one at a time, in the left column of my screen. Yet, now, I lost one of the windows when starting a Firefox session, and only three windows appear. Trying to recover all of the windows, since I have no menu option other than to restore the entire 4 window backup, I have clicked on TSM's top menu to restore all 4 windows. TSM does not respond to my single, left-click. A right-click of the TSM menu at top right of my screen makes no reference to "restore all windows in selected backup" or "restore all windows in latest saved session".

Essentially, TSM has maintained a perfect record of all TSM backups ever made, each showing date and time, but now, TSM will not restore even a single window, much less all of them. In past incidents when windows have been missing, I have successfully restored all windows of any backup I have chosen, and during that restoration, TSM actually restores, then closes windows which duplicate windows already open.

My "brute force" recourse is to restore the entire Windows 7 volume from a very recent image made in the imaging application Macrium Reflect, since all the TSM windows are so valuable to my work. But that does not resolve the TSM malfunction of failure to restore any of the saved tab collections.

Meantime, I have located the repository of TSM image collections, and have tried to start any of the images when TSM is active, by clicking on one of these dated image collections. This is an application malfunction, and I have tried to reach a TSM community discussion on a GitHub link, but am uncertain where to proceed next.

title: I cant sync to my Firefox browser on PC
content:
I am trying to switch from Chrome to Firefox. I installed it on my Macbook and my iPhone with no issue, but when I try to sign in to the browser on my PC I keep getting stuck after I enter my email it just doesn't take me to the password screen. after a few moments a red box that says "working" pops on the screen.

Signing in to the website to ask this question was not a problem whatsoever.

I tried syncing again and now it skips past the email entry screen and goes right to the password screen. After entering my password, nothing happens.

I would very much like to finish the migration from chrome. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

title: Regarding the situation where the ZEN browser translation function does not support Chinese
content: First of all, I am a human rights commissioner. Obviously, you don't need to ask too much about my experience. I have been conducting activities in mainland China, which means I have to visit overseas websites to get important news and bring it back to China. However, language communication is very important. I can't always look up in a dictionary to find out what the news is about. That will be a waste of time. So out of respect, I can only reply to you in English. Thank you for your understanding and support. I am a democratic whistleblower who supports Taiwan independence. You can do some research on my background. I respect your decision!
creator: shuihez

title: Signing into Mozilla account on Firefox Desktop not working
content: I have a new laptop and am trying to sign into my Mozilla account on Firefox Desktop. I successfully enter my email and password, receive the verification email, verify with the correct code, then connect for one second before my account is disconnected again. I can see this device listed on Firefox on my iPhone, but it says it's not connected on the device itself. Please help me understand why this new laptop will not stay connected to my account.
creator: btrhoades10

title: I CAN'T SEE COMMENTS FOR WSJ.COM ARTICLES
content:
I CAN'T SEE COMMENTS FOR WSJ.COM ARTICLES

Per the help articles and user input: I have cleared the history cash I went into settings > privacy and security > browser privacy > enhanced tracking protection > manage exceptions added WSJ, Barrons, and Market watch I went into settings > privacy and security > browser privacy > enhanced tracking protection and reset the security level to "custom" and "only in private windows" for tracking and suspected fingerprints I have turned off the privacy badger for WSJ, Barrons, and Market watch

EVERY TIME I START FIREFOX AND LOG INTO WSJ I CAN'T SEE THE COMMENTS

if i click on the grey shield and turn off "Enhanced Tracking Protection" I CAN see the comments. But i have to do it EVERY TIME i start up.

How do i turn "Enhanced Tracking Protection" off for WSJ and associated sites???
creator: Adrainc
